abstract_summ: As schools reopen as a result of low community transmission rates of COVID-19, parents and teachers will have understandable concerns about the risks to students and staff.John Tingle, Lecturer in Law, Birmingham Law School, University of Birmingham, discusses some recent reports in maternity care, which can be seen to also to have general application across all clinical specialities.General practitioners play a significant part in the COVID-19 pandemic by providing whole-person and patient-centred care during this time of crisis.From social isolation to working on the front line, covid-19 is posing serious challenges to mental health.Umair Shah, MD, Harris County Public Health executive director, on how COVID-19 has exposed gaps in the public health system.
title_summ: COVID-19 safety in maternity care: lessons for the whole NHS.Back to school: Safe for children with underlying medical conditions.Q&A: Preparing for Pandemic, An Interview with Umair Shah, MD, Harris County Public Health.General practitioners as frontiers in COVID-19: The Hong Kong experience.Healthcare regulators' responses to the COVID-19 pandemic.Maintaining mental health in the time of coronavirus
title_abstract_phrases: Professor Alan Glasper, from the University of Southampton, discusses how the Care Quality Commission and the Nursing and Midwifery Council are working during the COVID-19 pandemic.As schools reopen as a result of low community transmission rates of COVID-19, parents and teachers will have understandable concerns about the risks to students and staff.COVID-19 safety in maternity care: lessons for the whole NHS.John Tingle, Lecturer in Law, Birmingham Law School, University of Birmingham, discusses some recent reports in maternity care, which can be seen to also to have general application across all clinical specialities.General practitioners play a significant part in the COVID-19 pandemic by providing whole-person and patient-centred care during this time of crisis.Maintaining mental health in the time of coronavirusFrom social isolation to working on the front line, covid-19 is posing serious challenges to mental health.
